column4: Its actually a diff file.. Its actually a patch file for ethernet driver stuff.. now the article i read asked me to "apply the patch: patch<>" i tried the patch command and it gave me some hunk errors.. i think i m not able to use the command in the right format.. help please..
patch -p0 < pathtofile is thee syntax of the command IIRC
kk let me try it..
it says that the "#1 hunk failed at 942"
Are you sure the patch is against the correct source?
ya, i think so.. it was about resolving some ethernet problem with dell vostro 1510 in Ubuntu hardy.. i link to the patch was given in the article.. so i think.. that its correct..
Could you give me the path to the patch?

http://www.martinhenze.de/extern/r8168-8.006.00.hardy.diff this is the patch to the patchfile.. and this is the article i referred...   http://www.martinhenze.de/2008/05/24/ubuntu-linux-on-dell-vostro-1510/
And the directory you are sitting in, has the r8168.h right?
yes it has
Try patch -p1 < path.to.file
same error.. "ing file r8168.h #1 failed at 942"
Ok, open the r8168.h in gedit/leafpad
And tell me what do you see at line number 943
this is line 943  CSIAR_Addr_Mask = 0x0fff,
and this one is 942 "CSIAR_ByteEn_shift = 12,"
Yup, that source is not the same as the one with which this patch was generated
You can open up the patch file and see that it is completely different from what the patch file is expecting... that is why it is failing
Ya i can see.. but i have downloaded the latest version of realtek driver.. is it because of it..
i mean because of the latest version
Highly likely
may be i should consult the writer of the article.. newaz.. thanks for ur help..
No problems. Glad to help
